New Records: Virat Kohli scored the fastest double century in ODIs
Key Match Events: Ravindra Jadeja claimed five wickets as South Africa were skittled for 83 runs in 27.1 overs
Kohli’s unbeaten 101 had put the hosts in charge and moved him level with fellow Indian great Sachin Tendulkar on 49 one-day international hundreds
Shreyas Iyer hit 77 with seven fours and two sixes
Post-Match Reflections: Kohli made sure of his ton in the 49th over as India finished with 326-5 on a slow Kolkata wicket, thanks to late hitting by Jadeja (29 not out)
India maintained their 100% record in the group stage
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa lost half their side for 40 runs inside 14 overs
Rohit Sharma fell for a 24-ball 40 as he looked to launch first-change Kagiso Rabada over mid-off
Lungi Ngidi suffered an apparent hamstring injury later on to compound South Africa’s dismal day
